result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurie Gayle Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laurie Gayle Sutton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laurie Gayle Sutton was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $379.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $200.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any and all conditions DOC may impose

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laurie Gayle Sutton in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STATE recites plea as amended to misd. battery remove dom. enhancer to count 1 -  1 yr probation $579.00 costs - count 2 dismiss.  Atty McL and defendant agree.  Court grants motion to amend to delete domestic abuse enhancer.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of nc.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State argues sentencing.  Atty McL argues sentencing.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs $579.00  -aoda and absolute sobriety - any counseling doc may impose.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Laurie Gayle Sutton in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:17 PM Court calls case and recites appearances.  Count 1 amended to delete the domestic abuse and count 2 would be DRI / 1 year probation - $579.00 total fine.  Atty McL makes stmt.  Court questions the defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Atty McL entered plea of no contest.  Defendant is recanting her stmt.  Court to be reset  Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Laurie Gayle Sutton in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off the Record -  attny only 12 days on case  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Laurie Gayle Sutton in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel, NG by court, bond continues,  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
